content:
Easy, but fun enough :)
Just two details:
* I’m not sure "0" is a judicious choice of character, as it can easily be mingled with "O"
* Why giving L?

I'm mostly opposed to the problem in its current incarnation.

The biggest N size is 3. This means it's going to be faster and probably easier to solve to anyone by simple copypasting the Sierpinsky diagrams in the problem statement and test cases and replacing the characters with whatever's asked.

That's neither fun nor interesting.
I can only hope you didn't actually intend on submitting the boring problems here! :P

Point taken. I was personally disappointed that the verification text was so limited that I couldn't expand the result to higher sizes. I'll try and rework it so that the problem is not easily solved with a simple text replacement. Personally I find that the puzzles in the community section are getting a little too hard and we need to have a few more medium difficulty puzzles for those that are not at the 'top of the food chain' so to speak. Also, this was my first submission so I just wanted to test the waters.

I changed it to 0 rather than O because the O had formatting problems with the current font that is shown in the statement part of the problem. L is not necessary in some implementations however I put it in just in case.

Well, the font used in the puzzle description makes it hard to distinct 0 from O ; whatever, it is easy to fix when you get like me on first submit:

Failure
Found:  O
Expected:  0

But still annoying :D


About L, I don’t see which implementation could possibly use it ^^ I guess anyone can see that level 1 is on level 2 top-left, level 2 on level 3 top-left etc. But it can be OK to mislead a bit, and helps the puzzle description I guess.

The verification text size limitation bites me all the time, so yeah, I know what you feel.

This would change the spirit of the problem, but here's a way you can go beyond the size limitation: instead of asking to produce the full carpet, ask for the pixel at specific coordinates.

Oh wait, I just read your update, that's mostly what you already dit. Good job!

Seems upvote-worthy to me at least now.

Minor stuff:

* is there a way to either use a fixed-width font or at least constant-width characters (like, usually, digits and +-) for the given carpets? The level 3 one gets real ugly.

* I think it's usually spelled "Aladdin"

* scientific notation in the constraints "9.0E18" makes it sound like we can expect a fractional number here. I'd personally go with "9 * 10^18" to keep it integral.

Edit:

* oh, and you can merge the X1 and X2 constraint lines.

Thanks for the feedback. Made updates as suggested except for the formatting of the level 3 sample which I will have to experiment with. It seems the Statement text uses a different font than for the verification text which throws the width of each row off a slight bit in the Statement.

I've tried with 0 and +, I think it looks cool.
What do you think? http://imgur.com/6l3BnbW
Looks great! I've updated all the test cases and such to match. Thanks!

Good to go for me, then. Approved.

(I hope I won't regret approving without adjusting my answer and re-verifying)

(Edit: nope, no regrets, s'all good)
I updated it. Let me know what you think.
